qas.question: What legal system was introduced by the British in Florida

answers.text: British governors were directed to call general assemblies

qas.question: Did Florida send Representatives to Philadelphia for the Declaration of Independence

answers.text: Neither East Florida nor West Florida would send any representatives to Philadelphia to draft the Declaration of Independence

qas.question: Who did Florida side with during the revolution

answers.text: Florida would remain a Loyalist stronghold for the duration of the American Revolution.

qas.question: What legal system is still used by florida

answers.text: English-derived legal system which Florida still has today including trial by jury, habeas corpus and county-based government

qas.question: What legal system was not introduced by the British in Florida?
Who did Florida oppose during the revolution?

plausible_answers.text: trial by jury, habeas corpus and county-based government

qas.question: What legal system has never been used by Florida?
Where did East and West Florida send representatives?
What did representatives draft in Florida?

context: As a result of these initiatives northeastern Florida prospered economically in a way it never did under Spanish rule. Furthermore, the <a0_0>British governors were directed to call <b4_0>general assemblies<b4_0/><a0_0/> as soon as possible in order to make laws for the Floridas and in the meantime they were, with the advice of councils, to establish courts. This would be the first introduction of much of the <a3_0>English-derived legal system which Florida still has today including <b6_0>trial by jury, habeas corpus and county-based government<b6_0/><a3_0/>. <a1_0>Neither East Florida nor West Florida would send any representatives to <b7_0>Philadelphia<b7_0/> to draft the <b8_0>Declaration of Independence<b8_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0>Florida would remain a <b5_0>Loyalist<b5_0/> stronghold for the duration of the American Revolution.
